title: What is difference between pairing and connecting in Bluetooth? - Quora

response.answer_text: Pairing ideally* only happens once. The first time a pair of Bluetooth devices are going to connect the need to introduce themselves to one another, that’s pairing. Each time they are used together after that, turn on the phone’s Bluetooth and power up the other device, they automatically join together; that is connecting. * Like Den Bo mentioned in a comment there are circumstances when pairing will be required more than just once so I added the qualifier “ideally”

When you pair Bluetooth, you authorize the devices to connect and they remember that they are authorized. When they come into range and they need to connect, they remember and connect without any action by the user.
